title: Whitehall: Boy accidentally shoots himself at city park
content:
Whitehall police reported a 17-year-old Columbus boy apparently shot himself by accident July 18 at Robinwood Park.
Whitehall police reported a 17-year-old Columbus boy apparently shot himself by accident July 18 at Robinwood Park.
Police were called to Mount Carmel East Hospital at 5 p.m. July 18, where the boy was being treated for a gunshot wound to the leg that was not life-threatening.
The boy told police he was playing basketball at Robinwood Park when a group of people he was unable to describe approached his group. The boy further stated he was not familiar with the area and that someone from the group "shot in his direction" for an unknown reason.
Police reported the suspect's account was not credible and upon further questioning, the boy said he was with several friends and was smoking marijuana, and a gun "just went off in his pocket."
Others tried to patch the gunshot wound at a Beechwood Road residence before an adult there determined the boy needed to go to a hospital, according to reports.
The adult dropped the boys at the emergency room and said they were "grown enough to handle (it) on their own," reports said.
Columbus police were unable to locate the boy's parents, according to reports.
